column1: observation  or  defective  memory  or  a  dishonest  motive  (Vide,  Colin
Thom'e J in Bandaranaike v . Jagathsena 1984 2 Sri LLR 397).
In  State  of UP  v.  Anthony  the indian  Supreme  Court  stated that  'while
appreciating the evidence of a witness,  the approach must be whether the
evidence ... read as  a  whole  appears  to  have  a  ring  of truth'.  The  Court
went on  to  elaborate further  that  'Minor  discrepancies  on  trivial matters
not  touching  the  core  of the  case,  hyper  technical  approach  by  taking
sentences  torn  out of context here or there from  the  evidence,  attaching
importance to some technical error committed by the investigating officer
not going to  the  root of the  matter would not ordinarily permit rejection
of the evidence as a whole' ... "
